<a id="PlaneMesh"></a>

# PlaneMesh

**Inherits:** [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md) **\<** [Mesh](Mesh.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [QuadMesh](QuadMesh.md)

Class representing a planar [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Class representing a planar [PrimitiveMesh](PrimitiveMesh.md). This flat mesh does not have a thickness. By default, this mesh is aligned on the X and Z axes; this default rotation isn't suited for use with billboarded materials. For billboarded materials, change [orientation](PlaneMesh.md#PlaneMesh_property_orientation) to [FACE_Z](PlaneMesh.md#PlaneMesh_constant_FACE_Z).

\ **Note:** When using a large textured **PlaneMesh** (e.g. as a floor), you may stumble upon UV jittering issues depending on the camera angle. To solve this, increase [subdivide_depth](PlaneMesh.md#PlaneMesh_property_subdivide_depth) and [subdivide_width](PlaneMesh.md#PlaneMesh_property_subdivide_width) until you no longer notice UV jittering.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_PlaneMesh_Orientation"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **Orientation**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_PlaneMesh_Orientation)

<a id="PlaneMesh_constant_FACE_X"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Orientation](PlaneMesh.md#enum_PlaneMesh_Orientation) **FACE_X** = `0`

**PlaneMesh** will face the positive X-axis.<a id="PlaneMesh_constant_FACE_Y"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Orientation](PlaneMesh.md#enum_PlaneMesh_Orientation) **FACE_Y** = `1`

**PlaneMesh** will face the positive Y-axis. This matches the behavior of the **PlaneMesh** in Godot 3.x.<a id="PlaneMesh_constant_FACE_Z"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Orientation](PlaneMesh.md#enum_PlaneMesh_Orientation) **FACE_Z** = `2`

**PlaneMesh** will face the positive Z-axis. This matches the behavior of the QuadMesh in Godot 3.x.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>
